episodes.title: Scientology’s Trojan Horse Courses
episodes.description:
Every course and book in Scientology sounds innocent enough, but they all have a sinister intention. In terms of this course, it’s one of the first steps in Scientology’s process to brainwash and indoctrinate its members. The goal is to make anyone in your life who questions Scientology — out of love — seem like an enemy. So many families and friendships have been destroyed thanks to this course.

#Scientology #Cult #SanFrancisco #TomCruise

episodes.title: Woman Confronts Her Mom About Scientology
episodes.description: Just incredible. This young woman has an understanding of how evil Scientology is that far surpasses that of people three times her age. And you can see in her mother how resistant she was to accepting that Scientology isn't what she thought it was. By the way, the mom ended up becoming a fierce advocate against Scientology.

episodes.title: Why Tom Cruise Will Never Leave Scientology
episodes.description:
In 2016, I explained why Tom Cruise will never leave Scientology. Not only is he a true believer in Scientology, but he benefits from his incredible power within Scientology. Tom is the beneficiary of a level of power and treatment that even movie stars don't get. 

Read My Memoir About My Life In Scientology: https://amzn.to/3sYRXdX

episodes.title: David Miscavige's Camerawoman Speaks Out For First Time Since Escaping Scientology
episodes.description:
Rachael Hastings Adair joined Scientology's Sea Org (paramilitary workforce that runs and controls Scientology) in 2004. Rachael, who is a filmmaker, soon became a favorite of Scientology's image obsessed and criminal leader David Miscavige. During her time in Scientology, Rachael, due to her position, was witness to a great deal. In her first interview with Mike and Me, Rachael talks about the two things that led her to leave: she is gay (which in Scientology is one of the worst things you can be) and she was tired of witnessing Scientology cover up crimes against minors. 

Rachael finally escaped Scientology in 2020 and went straight to the FBI to tell them what she had witnessed. 
-------------------------------------------------
Read My Memoir About My Life In Scientology: https://amzn.to/3sYRXdX

episodes.title: Shelly Miscavige Update - Horrible Meeting With LAPD Chief On Scientology
episodes.description:
In June, thanks to the pressure many of you applied to his office, I met with the Chief of the Los Angeles Police Department, Michel Moore. 

On the agenda: discussing LAPD's inappropriate and corrupt relationship with Scientology, which includes how the LAPD handled the missing person's investigation into Shelly Miscavige.

I promised to update you on the meeting: it was a disaster.

From Chief Moore's antagonistic attitude to the insistence that Scientology is an excellent partner to the LAPD, I left the meeting in shock. 

Mike Rinder and I and Claire Headley discussed the meeting on our podcast's latest episode.

Read My Memoir About My Life in Scientology and Hollywood: https://amzn.to/3rialy7

episodes.title: Scientologists Aren't Allowed To Go To Law Enforcement - Leah Remini and Mike Rinder
episodes.description: On our second episode of our newly reborn podcast, Mike Rinder and I talk about the Scientology policies (which are like laws to Scientologists) that make it a high crime for a Scientologist to go to law enforcement when a crime has been committed against them by another Scientologist. This, of course, leads to a significant under reporting of crime. We also talk about what Scientology made Jen B (Jane Doe #1) go through when she told them that Danny Masterson had violated her.

episodes.title: Leah Remini & Michelle Visage Have An Honest Conversation On Scientology, + Fight Against The Church
episodes.description:
Released: August 5, 2019
Leah Remini sits down with guest host Michelle Visage to discuss Scientology and why she continues to fight against the church, including its Fair Game policy. She explains why and how she finally left the church of Scientology and why it took her so long. Plus, the consequences of that decision. 

#LeahRemini

episodes.description:

She tells TODAY’s Savannah Guthrie that she’s “not going to get a dime” for her efforts: "It’s for the victims… it’s for people who just maybe don’t have the strength to fight."

episodes.title: Leah Remini: The Jehovah’s Witnesses - A&E Special
episodes.description:
#leahremini #exjw #jehovahswitnesses

First off, thank you to Leah Remini for doing this documentary.  And big thanks and hugs to all the ex-JW’s that were on the A&E Special, and for openly sharing their experiences and stories. 

In this video, I share my thoughts about the show, triggers, and other stuff that came up. Regardless of how long you’ve been out of the JW Organization, (ExJW; DF’d; or just have JW family), there will be things from this Special that will stir up emotions, on various levels. 
Be mindful of this, and take care of yourselves. x

For people that are considering joining, leaving, or studying with Jehovah's Witnesses, please watch the A&E program. It is an honest look at real-life experiences of what happens in this Organization. 

———————
If you missed the A&E special that aired last night, (Nov 13/18), "Leah Remini - The Jehovah's Witnesses"... and don't have access to A&E, or have a cable service provider that let’s you stream it, here's a workaround I found…

Download the A&E app on your phone. 
Sign up with a new account, and you’ll get 3 credits to watch 3 programs, one of which you can choose this Special. 
Hope that works for any of you that are looking for it! 
:)  

UPDATE: Here's a link that was shared with me for those that are able to view it... https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x6x5upe
-------------------

About sharing stories and experiences - 

I love this quote by Iyanla Vanzant: 
"It's important that we share our experiences with others. Your story will heal you and your story will heal somebody else. When you tell your story, you free yourself and give other people permission to acknowledge their own story." 

--------------------

PLEASE NOTE: If you are only here to troll, preach, or be disrepectful, your comments will be deleted. 

This channel is meant to be a positive, respectful and welcoming space/community for people that are going through similar experiences from their association of the JW.Org . Especially those of you that have been disfellowshipped or shunned from your friends and family, know that you aren't alone. Thanks for being here.  :)

episodes.title: Leah Remini on her revealing new Scientology series  + Tom Cruise's Involvement
episodes.description:
[Re-Release 2016]

Leah Remini - who famously left the Church of Scientology in 2013, after being a member for 35 years - sits with Larry to discuss the organization's controversial practices, Tom Cruise's involvement, and why she welcomes the church to sue her over her new docuseries.

Scientology and the Aftermath
#LeahRemini #TomCruise #Scientology

Season 1

Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath
Season 1

"Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath" features stories from former members of the Church of Scientology whose lives have been affected by the Church's harmful practices. Along with a team of former high-ranking Scientology insiders who understand the inner workings and policies of the organization, Leah gives the victims a chance to be heard.

A&E leads the cultural conversation through high-quality, thought provoking original programming with a unique point of view. Whether it’s the network’s distinctive brand of award-winning disruptive reality, groundbreaking documentary, or premium scripted drama, A&E always makes entertainment an art. Visit us at aetv.com for more info.

Former Scientologist and "Aftermath" author, Leah Remini, describes the internal workings of the controversial religion.
